channel.title: JavaScript on Scrivener
channel.description: Recent content in JavaScript on Scrivener

item.title: Function.prototype.bind()
item.description: The bind() method creates a new function that, when called, has its this keyword set to the provided value, with a given sequence of arguments preceding any provided when the new function is called. const person1 = { name: 'Oleh', age: 46, logInfo: function() { console.log(`Name is ${this.name}`); console.log(`Age is ${this.age}`); } }; const person2 = { name: "Svitlana", age: 37 }; person1.logInfo(); person1.logInfo.bind(person2)(); As a result of using the method bind(), it is possible to borrow the logInfo function of person1 object to the person2 object.

item.title: Callback Function
item.description: The Callback function creates a function inside the other function as a parameter. As it is showed in the example below, checkInput function has a cb callback function as a first parameter and …strings variable as a second rest parameter. The callback function is called only when hasEmptyText condition is false, that means that there is no empty strings in the …strings variable. When checkInput function is called there is an array function ()=> as a cb callback function in its parameters and several strings in the …strings variable.

item.title: Terraform Docs
item.description: Required Inputs No required inputs. Optional Inputs The following input variables are optional (have default values): aws_access_key Description: Precreated AWS access key. Type: string Default: "" aws_ecr_region Description: AWS ECR region. Type: string Default: "us-west-2" aws_region Description: AWS region. Type: string Default: "us-west-2" aws_s3_backup_bucket Description: s3 backup backet name Type: string Default: "se-tpm-develop-backup-bucket" aws_secret_key Description: Precreated AWS secret key. Type: string Default: "" backend_port Description: The port the service on the EKS instances listen on.
